full_text: DETAILS On 07/27/81, Arturo GONZALEZ-Hernandez was arrested driving a 1968 Chevrolet Suburban (no plates), VIN CE168F112874, which contained nine (9) other undocumented aliens. The aliens were all from Central America, with the exception of one Mexican. Also arrested the same day as part of a conspiracy were, Leopoldo ALVARADO-Gonzalez, driving a 1972 Ford LTD (Dark Brown) with California Registration 691 GVJ, and Vicente DE LA HOYA-Sanchez, driving a 1972 Oldsmobile (Brown/Cream) , with Califoria Registration 486 FFX. Arturo GONZALEZ-Hernandez is an undocumented alien from Moxicali, Baja California, Mexico. Both, ALVARADO and DE LA HOYA are permanent resident aliens. The latter two immigrated aliens were arrested on the Sector Pilot's, Robert Dinoir, observations. Pilot Dinoir observed ALVARADO scouting the highways, and DE LA HOYA was observed conferring with ALVARADO, and scouting. A complaint was filed with the U.S. Magistrate in El Centro, California on 07/29/81, charging the three defendants with violation of 8 USC 1324, 18 USC 371, 8 USC 1325, and 18 USC 2. The case was transferred to San Diego, California, and a superceding complaint was filed by the U.S. Attorney's Office. On 09/23/81, the charges were dismissed against ALVARADO, and DE LA HOYA and GONZALEZ pled guilty to 8 USC 1325. GONZALEZ was sentenced to one (1) year, Imposition of Sentence Suspended, unsupervised probation. -2- ELC 10/23/81 FOIA (b)(6) A10 534 184
